channel.title: Max Stat Error In Compiler
channel.description:
Hey, i got a error in compiler.
[code]client.java:1947: illegal start of expression public int getSummonLvlForXp<int exp> { ^[/code]
Can someone fix this for me plz?
Greetz.[br][size=1]Posted on: March 22, 2007, 04:20:35 AM[/size][hr]someone plz?

item.title: Max Stat Error In Compiler
item.dc:creator: @brionnn brionnn
item.description:
@brionnn wrote:

Ok.

full code is [code]/SUMMONING/
public int getSummonXPForLevel(int level) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		if (lvl >= level) {
			return output;
		}
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
	
	return 0;
}


	
public int getSummonLvlForXP(int exp) {
	int points = 0;
	int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 250; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 250;
}[/code]

i just need to know what wrong in it[br][size=1]Posted on: March 22, 2007, 05:42:03 AM[/size][hr]=(

Read full topic

item.title: Max Stat Error In Compiler
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

The expression above that one isn’t completed, and you’re not allowed to declare a method WITHIN THE DECLARATION of a method.

Read full topic

item.title: Max Stat Error In Compiler

item.description:
@brionnn wrote:

For example, this is the thing i got an error from:

[code]}

public int getSummonLvlForXP(int exp) {
	int points = 0;
	int output = 0;

	for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 250; lvl++) {
		points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
		output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
		if (output >= exp) {
			return lvl;
		}
	}
	return 250;
}[/code]
